data.enText: chance or luck, especially in the way it affects people's lives
data.chText: （尤指影响人生的）机会，运气

data.enText: I have had the good fortune to work with some brilliant directors.
data.chText: 我有幸与一些卓越的主管人员共事。

data.enText: By a stroke of fortune he found work almost immediately.
data.chText: 他运气好，几乎立刻找到了工作。

data.enText: Fortune smiled on me (= I had good luck) .
data.chText: 我交了好运。

data.enText: a large amount of money
data.chText: 大笔的钱；巨款

data.enText: He made a fortune in real estate.
data.chText: 他在房地产上发了财。

data.enText: She inherited a share of the family fortune.
data.chText: 她继承了家庭的一份财产。

data.enText: A car like that costs a small fortune .
data.chText: 像这样的轿车要花一大笔钱。

data.enText: You don't have to spend a fortune to give your family tasty, healthy meals.
data.chText: 让家里人吃味道好又健康的餐食并不需要花许多钱。

data.enText: She is hoping her US debut will be the first step on the road to fame and fortune .
data.chText: 她希望她在美国的首次演出将是她走上名利双收之路的第一步。

data.enText: That ring must be worth a fortune .
data.chText: 那枚戒指肯定要值好多钱。

data.enText: the good and bad things that happen to a person, family, country, etc.
data.chText: （个人、家庭、国家等的）发展变化的趋势，命运，际遇

data.enText: the changing fortunes of the film industry
data.chText: 电影业的变迁

data.enText: the fortunes of war
data.chText: 战争的局势

data.enText: a reversal of fortune(s)
data.chText: 命运的扭转

data.enText: a person's fate or future
data.chText: （个人的）命运，前途

data.enText: She can tell your fortune by looking at the lines on your hand.
data.chText: 她可凭看手纹替你算命。

data.enText: a hostage to fortune
something that you have, or have promised to do, that could cause trouble or worry in the future
data.chText: 可能招惹麻烦（或担忧）的东西（或许诺）；造成后患的事物

data.enText: seek your fortune
to try to find a way to become rich, especially by going to another place
data.chText: 外出寻找发财机会；外出闯荡；闯世界

data.text: luck ♦ chance ♦ coincidence ♦ accident ♦ fortune ♦ fate ♦ destiny ♦ providence

data.enText: These are all words for things that happen or the force that causes them to happen.
data.chText: 以上各词均指机遇、命运、运气。

data.enText: luck
the force that causes good or bad things to happen to people
data.chText: 指机遇、命运、运气：

data.enText: This ring has always brought me good luck.
data.chText: 这戒指总是给我带来好运。

data.enText: chance
the way that some things happen without any cause that you can see or understand
data.chText: 指偶然、碰巧、意外：

data.enText: The results could simply be due to chance.
data.chText: 这结果可能纯属意外。

data.enText: coincidence
the fact of two things happening at the same time by chance, in a surprising way
data.chText: 指出人意料的巧合、巧事：

data.enText: They met through a series of strange coincidences.
data.chText: 他们因一连串奇妙的巧合而相遇。

data.enText: accident
something that happens unexpectedly and is not planned in advance
data.chText: 指意外、偶然的事：

data.enText: Their early arrival was just an accident.
data.chText: 他们早到仅仅是偶然而已。

data.enText: fortune
( rather formal ) luck or chance, especially in the way it affects people's lives
data.chText: 尤指影响人生的机会、运气：

data.enText: For once, fortune was on our side: the sun shone that day.
data.chText: 只有那次我们运气好，那一天阳光普照。

data.enText: fate
the power that is believed to control everything that happens and that cannot be stopped or changed
data.chText: 指命运、天数、定数、天意：

data.enText: Fate decreed that she would never reach America.
data.chText: 命中注定她永远到不了美国。

data.enText: destiny
the power that is believed to control events
data.chText: 指主宰事物的力量、命运之神：

data.enText: I believe there's some force guiding us─call it God, destiny or fate.
data.chText: 我总认为有某种力量在指引着我们——叫它上帝也罢，天意也罢，还是命运也罢。

data.enText: providence
( formal ) God, or a force that some people believe controls our lives and the things that happen to us, usually in a way that protects us
data.chText: 指上帝、苍天、天佑：

data.enText: He trusted in divine providence.
data.chText: 他相信上苍。

data.enText: fate, destiny or providence?
data.chText: 用fate、destiny还是providence？

data.enText: Providence is usually seen as being kind: even when it sends suffering, this is accepted as being part of God's plan. Fate can be kind, but this is an unexpected gift; just as often, fate is cruel and makes people feel helpless. Destiny is more likely to give people a sense of power: people who have a strong sense of destiny usually believe that they are meant to be great or do great things.
data.chText: 一般认为providence是善意的，即使降临苦难也是上帝安排的一部分；fate有时是善意的，但那只是意外的恩赐；同样经常地，fate也是残酷的，使人感到无能为力；destiny更可能给人力量的感觉，具有强烈使命感的人通常认为自己是天生伟大或成就伟大事业的人。

data.enText: by/through …luck/chance/coincidence/accident
It was… luck/chance/coincidence/accident/fortune/fate/providence that…
It's no coincidence/accident that…
pure/sheer/mere luck/chance/coincidence/accident
good/bad/ill luck/fortune
to have the … luck/fortune to do sth
to tempt fate/providence (= to do sth too confidently in a way that might mean that your good luck will come to an end)
sb's luck/fortune changes/turns
a stroke of luck/fortune/fate
a twist of fortune/fate

word_means: 发展变化的趋势，命运，际遇

means: (个人、家庭、国家等的)发展变化的趋势，命运，际遇

data.enText: a hostage to fortune
something that you have, or have promised to do, that could cause trouble or worry in the future
data.chText: 可能招惹麻烦（或担忧）的东西（或许诺）；造成后患的事物

data.enText: seek your fortune
to try to find a way to become rich, especially by going to another place
data.chText: 外出寻找发财机会；外出闯荡；闯世界

tr: an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that causes an event to result one way rather than another
example: we ran into each other by pure chance

tr: an unknown and unpredictable phenomenon that leads to a favorable outcome
example: it was my good luck to be there
they say luck is a lady
it was as if fortune guided his hand

tr: a large amount of wealth or prosperity
your overall circumstances or condition in life (including everything that happens to you)

example.ex: We had to eat out all the time. It ended up costing a fortune...
example.tran: 我们不得不总在外面吃饭，结果花了很多钱。

example.ex: He made a small fortune in the London property boom.
example.tran: 他在伦敦房产升温的时候发了一笔小财。

value.def: You can refer to a large sum of money as a fortune or a small fortune to emphasize how large it is.

example.ex: He made his fortune in car sales...
Having spent his rich wife's fortune, the Major ended up in a debtors' prison.
example.tran: 花光了他有钱老婆的财产之后，这位少校最后被关进了债务人监狱。

value.def: Someone who has a fortune has a very large amount of money.

example.ex: Government ministers are starting to wonder how long their good fortune can last.
example.tran: 政府部长们开始怀疑他们的好运还能够持续多久。

value.def: Fortune or good fortune is good luck. Ill fortune is bad luck.

example.ex: The electoral fortunes of the Liberal Democratic party may decline...
example.tran: 自由民主党的选举运势可能会下降。

example.ex: She kept up with the fortunes of the Reeves family...
example.tran: 她一直关注着里夫斯家族的兴衰。

example.ex: The company had to do something to reverse its sliding fortunes.
example.tran: 这个公司不得不采取一些措施扭转下滑的运势。

value.def: If you talk about someone's fortunes or the fortunes of something, you are talking about the extent to which they are doing well or being successful.

example.ex: He is certainly being smiled on by fortune.
example.tran: 现在他一定是得到了命运的垂青。

value.def: If you talk about the way someone or something is treated by fortune, you are referring to the good or bad luck that they have.
When someone tells your fortune, they tell you what they think will happen to you in the future, which they say is shown, for example, by the lines on your hand.

trans: 签饼(中国餐馆提供的薄脆饼，内有预测命运的小纸条)
签饼(中国餐馆提供的薄脆饼，内有预测命运的小纸条)
(企图通过跟有钱人结婚)猎财的人，攀龙附凤的人
